00030 /*
00031 This class is the result of Ondra's advice........
00032  
00033  Re: A Nib Question: Multiple Instantiations of Views
00034  FROM : Ondra Cada
00035  DATE : Thu Apr 04 13:14:14 2002
00036  
00037  On Thursday, April 4, 2002, at 10:16 , The Amazing Llama wrote:
00038  
00039  > What I want to do is instantiate multiple copies of Bar, with different 
00040  > text in the text objects, and pop them all into Foo so that all of them 
00041  > appear in a list.
00042  >
00043  > So the basic question is this: how do I
00044  >     - load a view from the nib so that I get the formatting information,
00045  >     - programmatically make lots of copies of it
00046  >     - programmatically change the text, and
00047  >     - programmatically put them all into the window?
00048  >
00049  > Can I?
00050  
00051  You can, but it would be the hard way.
00052  
00053  The simple one is to go proper MVC, making so no necessity of direct 
00054  connections between the window (and its contents) and the view (and its 
00055                                                                                                                                  contents). Then you can simply put the view into a spearate NIB, and load 
00056  it as many times as you like to: that's the easiest and most convenient 
00057  way of making "lots of copies" of anything in GUI.
00058  
00059  As for "changing the text" just use NSText(View|Field) services; as for 
00060  placing loaded views into the window use NSView services (or go NSTabView 
00061                                                                                                                    or NSMatrix or NSSplitView or whatever is suitable for your task).
00062  ---
00063  Ondra Cada
00064  OCSoftware:    <email_removed>              http://www.ocs.cz
00065  2K Development: o.<email_removed>  http://www.2kdevelopment.cz
00066  private        <email_removed>            http://www.ocs.cz/oc
00067  */
